alert.note: Alert for South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued February 25 at 7:37AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...AVALANCHE WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL ... * WHAT...The Forest Service Mount Shasta Avalanche Center has issued an avalanche warning for the backcountry of the Mount Shasta area of Northern California. HIGH avalanche danger is expected Saturday, February 25th, 2023. * WHERE...Mount Shasta, Castle Lake, the Eddy Mountains and Ash Creek Butte area east of Mount Shasta. * WHEN...In effect from Sat 06:30 PST to Sun 06:30 PST. * IMPACTS...A cold winter storm has brought three feet of low density snow combined with strong wind to the forecast area. Large avalanches could occur in a variety of areas in the mountains of Siskiyou County. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in, near, or below avalanche terrain is not recommended. Recreational users without backcountry avalanche skills are advised to stay out of the backcountry. Deep snow conditions exist. Consult http://shastaavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center. THIS STATEMENT DOES NOT INCLUDE SKI AREAS AND HIGHWAYS WHERE AVALANCHE MITIGATION IS NORMALLY DONE.
